author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: Life x 2 + 6
text:
‘When you see lights even higher than stadium lights, you are at prison,” writes Rachel Kushner, and that is where we are in her tough, prismatic and quite gripping novel “The Mars Room” (Scribner, 338 pages, $27). Specifically, we are at Stanville Women’s Correctional Facility in central California, where 29-year-old Romy Hall is serving two consecutive life sentences for murder. Two life sentences plus another six years, to be exact, an addition that seems like it must be a dark joke.
But it’s not a joke, and the insoluble...
